alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 02 at 9:44PM EDT until April 05 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Hazleton, Petersburg and Edwardsport. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the lower White River. Flooding will continue through the weekend. The flooding will remain in the minor category. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Additional rainfall possible this week may prolong flooding. Those with interests along the White River should monitor forecast updates for the next week or more. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding of low agricultural fields begin. Daviess CR 375 WN and North River Rd in Knox County located inside the levees are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Sunday /6:00 PM CDT Sunday/ the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
